name: Open TEC
tagline: Open Source Project (software and hardware) to get GPS data and calculate TEC ( Total Electron Content ) to be used in predicting the earthquake.
body: ### Inspired by Prof. Kosuke Heki of Hokkaido University ### Paper Heki, K., Ionospheric electron enhancement preceding the 2011 Tohoku-Oki earthquake, Geophys. Res. Lett. 38, L17312, doi:10.1029/2011GL047908, 2011 ### This is how it works: ``` 1. Get Raw GPS Data from Arduino + Itead Arduino GPS Shield in SiRF binary 2. Convert SiRF binary to RINEX using 'sirfdump' 3. Calculate TEC using 'gpstk' ``` ##### Misc: Global TEC Map Provided by Trimble (updated every 5 minutes)
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
